Obsolete (3.0) - Audio

s_alsa_device
Description:
Sets which device ALSA will be trying to open (when s_driver is set to alsa). Default is: "default", if that fails it will try "hw" and if that fails too, "plug:hw" will be tried.
Type:
string
s_alsa_latency
Description:
Specifies latency for ALSA. If you got distortion in sound, upper the value a bit. If you experience delays, try lowering this value.
Type:
float
s_alsa_noworkaround
Description:
If you are having problems with ALSA you can try to set this var to 1 before you try legacy drivers.
Type:
enum
Remarks:
Linux/FreeBSD only.
ValueDescription
0Workaround enabled.
1Workaround disabled. Try this if you are having problems with new ALSA driver.
s_bits
Description:
This defines how many sampling bits should be used, when using 16 bits the interpolation quality will be better.
Type:
enum
Remarks:
Linux only.
Use s_restart after you change it.
ValueDescription
1616 bit sound
88 bit sound
s_device
Description:
Allows you to choose from multiple sound devices.
Type:
string
Remarks:
Linux only.
Use snd_restart after you change it.

For OSS you should use "/dev/dsp", "/dev/dsp0", "/dev/dsp1", etc
For ALSA use "default", "dmix", etc
ValueDescription
device name
s_driver
Description:
Specifices which sounddriver to use: ALSA/OSS or experimental Pulseaudio.
Type:
enum
ValueDescription
alsaWill use ALSA drivers
ossWill use OSS drivers
pulseWill use experimental Pulseaudio drivers (note: have to be set in all loading configs before starting ezQuake to work!)
s_linearresample_stream
Description:
This variable is no longer used, and has no effect.
Type:
integer
s_noalsa
Description:
Determinates sound output for linux clients: ALSA (0=default) or OSS.
Type:
enum
Remarks:
If you dont know what is ALSA and OSS - leave it at default value.
ValueDescription
0Use ALSA sound output
1Use OSS sound output
s_oss_device
Description:
Specifies which device OSS will try to open. Default is "/dev/dsp"
Type:
string
s_pulseaudio_latency
Description:
Specifies latency for Pulseaudio. If you got distortion in sound, upper the value a bit. If you experience delays, try lowering this value.
Type:
float
s_stereo
Description:
Use stereo or mono sound
Type:
boolean
Remarks:
Linux only.
Use s_restart after you change it.
ValueDescription
falsemono
truestereo
s_uselegacydrivers
Description:
If you are having problems with the new ALSA/OSS drivers you can enable this to be able to use legacy sound drivers, as in the ones used before v2.1.
Type:
enum
Remarks:
Linux/FreeBSD only.
ValueDescription
0Will use new sound drivers for ALSA/OSS
1Will use legacy drivers for ALSA/OSS (as used in versions before 2.1)

Obsolete (3.0) - Authentication

auth_validate
Type:
boolean
Remarks:
If you have
'auth_warninvalid 1' and someone gives a dirty hash in a version response
(because they are using a hacked client that can't work out the right
response), the client will print something like
'Warning Invalid Client: playername (userid)' in your console ('auth_warninvalid 0' is default).
ValueDescription
falseIf you don't want your client to validate other ezQuake clients.
truewhich performs the validation (but you need to use 'validate_clients'
auth_viewcrc
Type:
boolean
ValueDescription
falsethe client hides the authentication CRC in f_version responses.
truethe client shows you the authentication CRC in f_version responses.
auth_warninvalid
Description:
Check auth_validate.
Type:
float

Obsolete (3.0) - Input Systems

_windowed_mouse
Type:
boolean
ValueDescription
falseDisable windowed mouse support so you can use the mouse in other applications.
trueEnabled windowed mouse support so you can use the mouse in the client.
cl_showkeycodes
Description:
This variable enables/disables the output of informations to the currently pressed and/or released keys.
Type:
enum
ValueDescription
0Switch off output of scancode/keymapping information (Default)
1information about keys will be printed when the keys are pressed.
2information about keys will be printed when releasing the keys.
3information about keys will be printed when the keys are pressed and also when they are released.
hud_mouserate_align_x
Description:
Vertical alignment of the mouserate HUD element. See the HUD manual for more info.
Type:
string
hud_mouserate_align_y
Description:
Vertical alignment of the mouserate HUD element. See the HUD manual for more info.
Type:
string
hud_mouserate_frame
Description:
Opacity of the background of the mouserate HUD element
Type:
float
hud_mouserate_frame_color
Description:
Defines the color of the background of the mouserate HUD element. See HUD manual for more info.
Type:
string
hud_mouserate_order
Description:
This defines the order of drawing the HUD elements. That means you can change will be drawn on top of other elements. See HUD manual for more info
Type:
integer
hud_mouserate_place
Description:
Placement of the mouserate HUD element. HUD elements can be place into various screen areas or other elements. See HUD manual for more info
Type:
string
hud_mouserate_pos_x
Description:
Horizontal relative position of the mouserate HUD element
Type:
integer
hud_mouserate_pos_y
Description:
Vertical relative position of the mouserate HUD element
Type:
integer
hud_mouserate_show
Description:
Visibility of the mouserate HUD element
Type:
boolean
ValueDescription
false
true
in_di_buffered
Description:
Direct Input: Use Immedia data instead of buffered mode of reading.
Type:
boolean
Remarks:
This setting has been added only because Direct Input allows such mode of use. It is not going to decrease input lag, make the mouse responsiveness better, or anything like that. Read the official documentation on Direct Input to know the difference between buffered and immediate mode of use.
ValueDescription
falseUse immediate data
trueUse events buffer to process the input data
in_di_bufsize
Description:
Size of the direct input buffer
Type:
integer
Remarks:
On some circumstances the default size does not have to be sufficient
in_evdevice
Description:
Specify device for evdev mouse. Should be absolute path like /dev/input/event0
use in_evdevlist command to get lost of devices
Type:
string
Remarks:
You should have read access to your device.
sudo chmod 644 /dev/input/event* should help you if you have trouble
ValueDescription
absolute path to mouse event device
in_m_os_parameters
Description:
Allows you to use your system mouse settings in the client
Type:
enum
ValueDescription
0Do not keep any of the system mouse settings
1Keep acceleration settings
2Keep speed settings
3Keep both acceleration and speed settings
in_m_smooth
Description:
Enables advanced mouse smoothing. You have to be using Direct Input for this to work.
Type:
boolean
ValueDescription
false
true
in_mmt
Description:
Multithreaded mouse.
For most users in_mmt 1 + evdev gives the most smooth input
Type:
boolean
Remarks:
Linux only and evdev (in_mouse 3) only.
ValueDescription
falseRead mouse data in main thread
trueUse separate thread for reading mouse data
in_mouse
Description:
Different types of mouse input
[OBSOLETE in ezQuake 3.0]
Type:
enum
Remarks:
Linux: You have to set in_evdevice to proper value (/dev/input/eventX). Use command in_evdevlist to get the lost of proper values. Also in_mmt makes your mouse more smooth.
ValueDescription
0Mouse off
1Windows: standard mouse; Linux: DGA mouse
2Windows: Direct Input; Linux: X Mouse
3Windows: Raw Input; Linux: EVDEV mouse
in_raw_allbuttons
Description:
Forces RAW Input handler to treat more incoming signals as mouse buttons. Helps if you cannot get some mouse buttons working in the game.
Type:
boolean
ValueDescription
falseOnly standard set of events is interpreted as mouse buttons
trueMore events are interpreted as mouse buttons
joystick
Description:
Toggles usage of joystick device.
Type:
boolean
ValueDescription
falseDo not use joystick.
trueUse joystick input.
keymap_name
Description:
This holds the name of the current keymappings; it has (currently) only informational purposes. If no keymapping is active, it will contain the name "Default". If a keymapping will be active and no name has been set, "Custom" will be used as name. It can easily be set with "keymap_name <layoutname>"
Type:
float
m_forcewheel
Type:
boolean
ValueDescription
falseDisable.
trueIf you have problems to get MWHEELUP and MWHEELDOWN working set this to 1.
m_rate
Description:
This variable should be set to your mouse rate (in Hz).
Note: need -m_smooth and -dinput to commandline.
Type:
float
m_showrate
Type:
boolean
Remarks:
Note: need -m_smooth and -dinput to commandline.
ValueDescription
falseDisable
truePrint current mouse rate

Obsolete (3.0) - Invalid

hud_fps_decimals
Description:
How many decimal number should the FPS HUD element contain
Type:
integer
Remarks:
Code says always three decimals

Obsolete (3.0) - Software Renderer

d_mipcap
Type:
enum
ValueDescription
0High texture detail.
1Medium texture detail.
2Low texture detail.
3Minimum texture detail.
d_mipscale
Type:
enum
ValueDescription
0Full object detail
1Some object detail
2Medium object detail
3Low object detail
d_subdiv16
Type:
boolean
ValueDescription
falsePrecise texture mapping (slower, more accurate).
truePerspective correction only every 16 pixels (faster, less accurate).
sw_contrast
Description:
Change contrast.
Type:
float
sw_gamma
Description:
Change gamma.
Type:
float

Obsolete (3.0) - Video

_vid_default_mode
Description:
This variable sets the default video mode that the client uses.
Type:
float
_vid_default_mode_win
Description:
This variable sets the default video mode that the client uses when windowed.
Type:
float
block_switch
Type:
boolean
ValueDescription
falseDo not block task-switching
trueBlock task-switching
con_particles_alpha
Description:
Sets the transparency of con_particles_images.
Type:
float
ValueDescription
From 0....1. 0 is invisible, 1 is completely solid.
gl_ztrick
Description:
This variables toggles the use of a trick to prevent the clearning of the
z-buffer between frames. When this variable is set to "1", the game will not
clear the z-buffer between frames. This will result in increased performance
but might cause problems for some display hardware.
Type:
boolean
ValueDescription
falseDo not use the z-buffer trick.
trueUse the z-buffer trick.
r_aliastransadj
Description:
Not much is known about this variable except for that increasing the value will
cause the player models to be displayed smaller.
Type:
float
r_aliastransbase
Description:
Not much is known about this variable except for that increasing the value will
cause the player models to be displayed smaller.
Type:
float
r_ambient
Description:
This variable controls the amount of ambient lighting on the map. When this
variable is increased the map will become brighter and all walls and objects
will be rendered in a lighter color.
It was removed in QWCL and has been re-introduced in this client, however it
can only be used when the server is running with cheats enabled (for example
"qwsv -cheats"), because it could be used as a cheat by making it easier to see
players in dark corners when no fullbright skins are used.
Type:
float
r_clearcolor
Description:
This variable changes the color of the areas outside the map, commonly seen when free floating as a spectator.
Type:
float
r_draworder
Description:
Allows you to see through object - for development purposes only.
Type:
boolean
Remarks:
Not allowed in multiplayer. See 'developer 1' too.
ValueDescription
falseStandard behaviour - first draws object far from you then closer to you.
trueFirst draws closest object, then the more distanced ones.
r_dspeeds
Type:
boolean
ValueDescription
falseDo not display renderer speed statistics.
trueDisplay renderer speed statistics.
r_graphheight
Description:
This variable used to set the number of lines displayed in the "r_timegraph" command.
Type:
float
r_max_size_1
Type:
enum
ValueDescription
0Off.
1Blend map textures.
2Blend map textures and bsp entities (ammo, health etc.)
r_maxedges
Description:
This variable sets the maximum number of plane surface edges to be rendered.
Actual default (and minimal) value is 2000.
On some new maps you may need to increase this value.
See also r_maxsurfs, r_reportedgeout, r_reportsurfout.
Type:
float
r_maxsurfs
Description:
This variable sets the maximum number of plane surfaces to be rendered.
Actual default (and minimal) value is 2000.
On some new maps you may need to increase this value.
See also r_maxedges, r_reportedgeout, r_reportsurfout.
Type:
float
r_numedges
Type:
boolean
ValueDescription
falseDo not print information about the number of edges.
truePrint information about the number of edges.
r_numsurfs
Type:
boolean
ValueDescription
falseDo not print information about the number of surfaces.
truePrint information about the number of surfaces.
r_polymodelstats
Type:
boolean
ValueDescription
falseDo not print polygon model statistics.
truePrint polygon model statistics.
r_reportedgeout
Type:
boolean
ValueDescription
falseDo not report when running out of edges.
trueReport when running out of edges.
r_reportsurfout
Description:
Toggle the display of how many surfaces where not displayed. This
shouldn't happen during normal game play, only when in noclip mode.
Type:
float
r_timegraph
Type:
boolean
ValueDescription
falseDo not display the timegraph.
trueDisplay the timegraph.
r_turbwarp
Type:
boolean
Remarks:
SW only!
This variable has the same effect as r_waterwarp in other quake clients.
ValueDescription
falseDisable warping of surfaces.
trueEnable warping of surfaces.
r_zgraph
Type:
boolean
ValueDescription
falseDo not display the z-graph.
trueDisplay the z-graph.
sb_showcounters
Description:
This toggles whether ezQuake should display the number of servers or players in
the status line.
Type:
boolean
ValueDescription
falsedo not show the server/player counter in the status line
trueshow the server/player counter in the status line
scr_autoid_drawname
Description:
Controls if the player name should be drawn when using scr_autoid >0.
Type:
boolean
ValueDescription
falsePlayer name is not drawn above player when scr_autoid >0
truePlayer name is drawn above player when scr_autoid >0
vid_allowExtensions
Type:
vid_depthbits
Type:
vid_stencilbits
Type:

Obsolete (3.0) - VOIP

cl_voip_capturingvol
Description:
Voice (VOIP) support. Volume multiplier applied while capturing, to avoid your audio from being heard by others.
Type:
integer
cl_voip_micamp
Description:
Amplifies your microphone when using voip.
Type:
integer
cl_voip_play
Description:
Enables voip (voice chat) playback.
Type:
boolean
ValueDescription
false
true
cl_voip_send
Description:
Enable sending of voice (voip) to the server.
Type:
enum
Remarks:
Commands +void / -void emulate toggling this value to 2.
ValueDescription
0disabled
1voice-activated
2always activated
cl_voip_showmeter
Description:
Shows your speech volume above the at the bottom-left of the screen.
Type:
enum
ValueDescription
0Hide
1Show when transmitting
2Always show (ignore voice-activation)
cl_voip_showmeter_x
Description:
Adjust horizontal position of the voice volume meter.
Type:
integer
Remarks:
See cl_voip_showmeter.
cl_voip_showmeter_y
Description:
Adjust vertical position of the voice volume meter.
Type:
integer
Remarks:
See cl_voip_showmeter.
cl_voip_vad_delay
Description:
Keeps sending voice data for this many seconds after voice activation would normally stop.
Type:
float
cl_voip_vad_threshhold
Description:
This is the threshhold for voice-activation-detection when sending voip data.
Type:
float
mumble_enabled
Description:
Turn on mumble positional audio support.
Type:
boolean
Remarks:
Requires mumble to be loaded before toggling this on.
ValueDescription
false
true

Obsolete (Commands)

floodprotmsg
Description:
Sets the message displayed after flood protection is invoked.
Example: floodprotmsg "Shut up whiner!"
Type:
float
userdir
Description:
userdir [dir [type]]
Addition of the given directory to the list searched files
Type:
enum
ValueDescription
0<quake_dir>/<gamedir>/<dir>
1<quake_dir>/<dir>/<gamedir>
2<quake_dir>/qw/<dir>/<gamedir>
3<quake_dir>/qw/<dir>
4<quake_dir>/<dir>
5$HOME/qw/<dir>

Obsolete (server infokeys)

pm_bunnyspeedcap
Description:
This is experimental code intended to restore class balance in TF. If you set
this cvar to something like 1.5 or 2, a solider will not be able to bunnyhop as
fast as a scout does :) Note that this cvar is optional and disabled by default,
so it will in NO WAY affect gameplay unless you set it explicitly to anything
but 0.
Type:
float
pm_ktjump
Description:
You can change value of ktjump.
Type:
float
pm_pground
Description:
Enables 'persistent onground flag' physics tweak. Its only use is that it makes pm_airstep work better.
Type:
integer
Remarks:
This extension makes use of Z_EXT_PF_ONGROUND to ensure correct movement prediction by clients. Prediction errors shouldn't be very noticeable anyway even with old clients.
pm_slidefix
Description:
When set to 1, Upon decsension from a sloped surface, the player doesn't "drop" (which is a bug in QW), but smoothly slides, as it was in NQ.
Type:
boolean
ValueDescription
falseDisable
trueEnable
watervis
Description:
This server-side cvar is mirrored to serverinfo as a hint to clients on whether the server is using the so-called watervised maps.
Type:
boolean
Remarks:
It's a bad idea to use watervis 1 if the maps the server is using are not watervised. Liquids will appear 'transparent' but you won't be able to see any items/players/etc through it. And it is a bad idea anyway because Quake maps were not designed for transparent water (or other liquids); enabling it changes gameplay, decreases fps and produces more network traffic and puts non-GL players at a disadvantage because the software renderer doesn't support transparent water (yet).
Not saved to config with cfg_save command.
ValueDescription
falseNo watervis.
trueGLQuake users can see through liquids if they set gl_turbalpha to a value < 1.

Published with GitHub Pages
